result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah Scott Stephenson

defendant.name: Stephenson, Noah Scott
defendant.address: 6219 S. US Highway 51, Lot 3, Janesville, WI 53546

records.addlTxt: Agreement to hold open felony plea

8:31 AM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger  in court for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 dismissed and read in. Count 2 defendant pleads guilty. Court withholds finding of guilt and holds open count 2. Sentence credit 24 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:44 AM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:00 PM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney stands mute; Court enters not guilty plea and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:11 PM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Victim defendant's mom appeared in person. Preliminary hearing requested by Zoom and scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 2PM. Court modifies bond conditions regarding defendant's mother to: No violent or disorderly contact with defendant's mother and No discussion of case. Previous conditions remain. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse by October 14, 2022.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.L.S. or  A.L.R. unconditionally, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No violent or disorderly contact with T.A.S. No discussion of case with T.A.S.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:34 PM  Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  $500.00 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 3:00 PM

No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.L.S., A.L.R. or T.A.S. unconditionally, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with trailer home park located at 6219 S U.S. Highway 51, Janesville Wisconsin. May request law enforcement assistance one time to assist in the retrieval of personal possessions at residence.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
